message.content:
cs.LO, cs.FL, cs.DS, cs.LT, cs.AI 

The paper deals with temporal logics and automata on multi-attributed data words, which are structures that combine a sequence of data values with attributes. This topic is closely related to formal language theory, automata theory, and logic. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.LO (Logic in Computer Science). Additionally, the paper introduces new extensions and fragments of temporal logics and automata, which are relevant to the study of formal languages and automata. Hence, cs.FL (Formal Languages and Automata Theory) and cs.DS (Data Structures and Algorithms) are also likely sub-categories. Moreover, the paper discusses the complexity of the decision problems for the introduced logics and automata, which is a typical topic in theoretical computer science. Therefore, cs.LT (Theoretical Computer Science) is another possible sub-category. Finally, the paper proposes a reduction to nested multi-counter systems, which are a type of algorithm used in artificial intelligence. Hence, cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) is also a possible sub-category.
